Title: Rectification Versus Interpretation: The Nature and Scope of the Equitable Jurisdiction
Abstract: © 2016 Cambridge Law Journal and Contributors.This article argues that mistakes in written contracts should be corrected under the equitable doctrine of rectification rather than the common law of interpretation. But rectification on the basis of a common mistake should only be granted where both parties are actually mistaken. Any other approach is inconsistent with the nature of the equitable jurisdiction, and blurs the boundary between common mistake and unilateral mistake rectification.
